Package io.github.ai4ci.abm.behaviour

package io.github.ai4ci.abm.behaviour
Behaviour models for the agent-based simulator.

The classes in this package implement per-agent behaviour state machines used during an update cycle. Behaviour models are small, focused enums or classes that implement BehaviourModel (which itself extends State.BehaviourState). They encapsulate the decision logic executed for each person during the model's history update and state update phases.

Runtime context

Behaviour state machines are driven from the core mechanics in io.github.ai4ci.abm.mechanics. Each update cycle proceeds roughly in the following order:

  1. history update — behaviour models may record events (for example seeking a test or recording contacts); implemented via updateHistory(...) in behaviour enums;
  2. state update decision — the behaviour state's nextState(...) method is invoked to decide the next behaviour state for the person; this is where transitions, timed triggers and checks (e.g. testing results or compliance) are implemented;
  3. state commit — the chosen BehaviourState is attached to the Person's runtime state and used by the mechanics for the next timestep.

Helper utilities

Behaviour implementations should use the helpers in StateUtils for common operations such as branching back to a previously saved behaviour (see StateUtils.toLastBranchPoint(io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.StateMachineContext)), applying compliance/mobility modifiers, and scheduling tests (e.g. doPCR, doLFT, seekPcrIfSymptomatic). These helpers keep behaviour enums concise and focused on control flow rather than low-level state manipulation.

Design notes

  • Behaviour models are intentionally small and declarative: each enum value represents a distinct behaviour state and implements the transition logic in nextState(...).
  • Where a behaviour needs to temporarily suspend the agent's previous behaviour (for example during lockdown) the mechanics support branching to the behaviour and later returning via the branch-point helper methods.
  • Testing and isolation behaviours often implement both updateHistory(...) (to schedule tests) and nextState(...) (to react to test results). See SmartAgentLFTTesting and SmartAgentTesting for examples.

Where to look next

  • State — behaviour/state interfaces and shared state types used by the mechanics;
  • StateUtils — helpers for common state-machine operations (branching, compliance adjustments, testing);
  • Enum implementations in this package (for example ReactiveTestAndIsolate, SmartAgentTesting, LockdownIsolation) which show typical usage patterns.

  • Class
    Description
    BehaviourModel
    Called during an update cycle before any changes have been made This means any references to state refers to current state, but any references to history refer to the previous state.
    LockdownIsolation
    A behaviour model that works with ReactiveLockdown, implementing policy changes by allowing people to enter a low activity state.
    NonCompliant
    Non compliant behaviour model.
    ReactiveTestAndIsolate
    Reactive test and isolate behaviour model.
    SmartAgentLFTTesting
    A behaviour model for people who will test reactively with LFTs, and then reflexively with PCRs.
    SmartAgentTesting
    Smart agent testing behaviour model.
    Symptomatic
    A behaviour model for people who are symptomatic.
    Test
    A test behaviour model that does nothing.
